results.title: Vietnam: The Ten Thousand Day War. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Don North, Paul Lang, Ron Kelly, Ian Macleod, Cinequity Funding and Information Television Productions
results.brief_description: Days of Decision - examines the gradual falling out of Washington and Saigon, and President Johnson’s crucial decision to send combat troops into South Vietnam. “Uneasy Allies” - looks at the effects, both political and cultural, that Americans have on the country that they are inhabiting.

results.title: Sequence and story
results.creator_credit: Don White, George Johnson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
In this film a group of children manipulate reality using a series of photographs of their own activities. As they lay out the photos in different sequences, the story of their day changes. Simple, realistic dialogue and a combination of live action and still photographs capture the viewer’s imagination.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Sept Visions Fugitives
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Sept Visions Fugitives was produced in China. Cahen creates impressionistic transformations of landscape and people. He writes: “The looking and listening audiences are confronted — in addition to the pure impressions — with basic questions about work (the boy using a traditional device to shake the feathers from the mattress) about freedom, about life in China … and ultimately about life and death: the burial, the bird, the man with a sheaf of straw on his back symbolizing the passage, the beyond ….. I had to struggle to make what I know are stereotyped images my own. The pure impressions and raw filmic material are completely reworked, going much further than the original takes.” Source: Electronic Arts Intermix [www.eai.org]

results.title: September '51
results.creator_credit: Raymond Quint and Australian Film and Television School
results.brief_description:
Looks at the Menzies LCP government’s attempt to ban the Communist Party in Australia in the referendum of 1951 through the dramatic portrayal of the life of a young couple who are members of the party. Highlights the near hysterical atmosphere of this period in Australia’s history.
Cast includes Martin Vaughn, Barry Otto and John Howard.

results.title: Separate tables
results.creator_credit: Delbert Mann, Harold Hecht and Clifton Productions
results.brief_description: This sensitive character study, set in an English seaside hotel, looks at human frailties as seen through the eyes of a small group of residents, many tortured by emotional turmoil and unhappy pasts. Stars Rita Hayworth, Deborah Kerr and Burt Lancaster including Academy Award performances by David Niven and Wendy Hiller for Best Actor and Best Supporting Actress. Based on the play by Terence Rattigan.

results.title: sentinelle endormie = The sleeping sentry (Cinemascope Print)
results.brief_description:
In 1812, in Chalons-sur-Marne, three doctors are plotting to assassinate emperor Napoleon. But when Doctor Mathieu realises that the assassination plan may involve killing innocent by-standers, his resolve starts to crumble.

Credits: Director, Jean Dreville ; writer, Noel-Noel ; photography, Pierre Petit ; music, Georges Auric.
Cast: Noel-Noel, Pascale Audret, Michel Galabru, Francis Blanche, Micheline Luccioni, Raymond Souplex.

results.title: Sentences and paragraphs
results.creator_credit: John Moss and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Celebrated author Margaret Clark discusses this most fundamental topic. Margaret reads from one of her books to illustrate key points. Also helping to provide interest in what can be perceived as a boring topic, is a leading Melbourne comedian and mime artist, Richard Jones. The program is funny, highly informative and definitely not boring! Suitable for Primary-Lower Secondary level students.

results.title: King Henry the Fourth. Part 2
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Jon Finch as King Henry IV, David Gwillim as Prince Hal, Anthony Quayle as Falstaff. Despite his success at Shrewsbury, King Henry has more insurrection to contend with. As the play closes, a reconciliation takes place between Henry and Prince Hal who, on the death of Henry, becomes the new King Henry V.

results.title: Measure for measure (BBC)
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
After deputising Angelo to enforce Vienna’s long ignored laws, Duke Vincentio purports to leave the city but actually remains to observe the proceedings, disguised as Friar Lodowick. Angelo revives an old statute against fornication and sentences Claudio to death for seducing Juliet, his betrothed. However, when Claudio’s sister Isabella, a religious novice, pleads for his life, her beauty so inflames Angelo’s own passions that he is very willing to ignore the law, promising her brother’s freedom if she yields to him. Vincentio, advises Isabella to pretend to cede to Angelo’s wishes. Once Vincentio reveals his true identity Angelo is severely castigated and ordered to marry Mariana to whom he was formerly betrothed.

results.title: Twelfth night
results.creator_credit: John Gorrie, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Felicity Kendall as Viola, this is a production of Shakespeare’s comedy of magic, romantic deception and foolish love. The production features a talented cast, and it remains faithful to Shakespeare’s text.
